III.i.1.A.3.b
.
Reserve Service Programs That Constitute Active Duty
Since 1955, members of the Reserve component have served in full time operational support positions characterized by the service departments as active duty under
10 U.S.C
.  Such programs include
ADS, and
AGR.
ADS and AGR service in the Reserves meets the definition of active duty if the facts of record establish that the service was
full-time, and
for operational or support purposes, as opposed to training.
Reference
:  For more information on full-time service in the Reserves, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 1.A.2.c
and
d
.
